column4: hey guys, is there any way to view all the shortcuts for the compiz-fusion effects?
I used to have a beryl manager when I was using that... but well I'm using standard visual effects now
install the compizconfig-settings-manager
thanks
it'll be under system->prefs->advanced desktop
edit your /etc/apt/sources.list , comment out the cdrom line near the top (you may need to uncomment [remove the # at the beginning of the line] for all lines starting with 'deb '])
one or the other is required for compiz ...
I have an nvidia card... am I using AIGLX?
yes
reduce FSAA . Otherwise, I know little to nothing about nvidia
or maybe 800x600 ;)
get rid of it, just keep your kernels in the /boot on the root partition ;)
oh =S. Err how should I do that?
but resizing issues? None that I can think of :)
you could unmount boot , then run sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-image-$(uname -r) grub
ahh ok good. would I need to reboot onto a liveCD? or is unmounting the partition good enough?
for resizing I mean. I think I'll move to /boot next clean install
no reason you couldn't resize it
great. Thanks
do you have any idea what happened to my system/what I can do to fix it?
I'd start with sudo apt-get remove --purge gdm , then sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop (since that package will be removed also)
ahh. Alright, I'll give it a shot. Thanks =D
